q22.question: Describe Ben's character
q22.answer: ['A witty, charismatic serial killer who is a mysogynistic, racist xenophobe']
q22.recall: Ben's character can be described as charismatic, sadistic, and escalating in violence. He targets women, immigrants, and postmen, and his actions include rape and murder. He takes pleasure in boasting about his killings to his girlfriend and friends. He is also manipulative, as he convinces a film crew led by Remy to join him on his sadistic adventures, recording them for a documentary. Despite his violent tendencies, he is able to maintain a facade of normalcy, as seen when his girlfriend and friends continue to offer him presents after witnessing him kill someone during a birthday dinner. However, Ben's violence becomes more and more random, leading to the killing of an acquaintance in front of his girlfriend and friends. Eventually, Ben's actions lead to revenge being taken on him and his family, resulting in the death of his parents and girlfriend. This prompts him to leave, as he realizes he may have killed someone connected to the local mob.
q22.vectordb: Ben is described as a witty, charismatic serial killer who engages in sadistic adventures and holds forth at length about various topics. He is misogynistic, racist, and targets vulnerable individuals for his killings. The film crew that joins him becomes increasingly involved in the murders. Ben's violence escalates until he is eventually killed by an off-camera gunman.
